intro: Tephrosia gracilis, commonly known as slender tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, arranged in small clusters, and it produces small, elongated pods containing seeds. Tephrosia gracilis is often found in disturbed soils and can be used in traditional medicine for its various therapeutic properties.
